title.narrative: Provision of Emergency Agriculture Support to Communities Affected by Floods and Landslides in Rwanda

description.narrative: In total, 2,800 eligible households will be identified and profiled by FAO in close collaboration with other UN agencies involved in project implementation (IOM), local administration and Rwandan Ministry of Agriculture (MINAGRI) and Ministry of Emergency Management (MINEMA). FAO and partners will distribute 2,800 packages composed of agriculture tools (hoes, Shovels, pickaxes and watering cans) and improved seeds (early varieties of maize and fortified beans) targeting the most vulnerable household’s affected by floods, with crop land damaged and crop destroyed. A particular focus will be on households being in Ubudehe2 categories 1-2, or household composed of other vulnerable people including female and old people, pregnant and lactating women, children and people with disabilities. Information on activities will be collected and shared using sex and age disaggregated data. Distribution of materials will adhere to national guidelines for COVID-19 transmission prevention, e.g. physical distancing. Distribution will be supported by awareness raising and training to 2,800 targeted household heads, the project will distribute brochures with technical information and will cover aspects on soil protection, modern cropping technique, use of manure and chemical fertilizer, nutritious local vegetable varieties and diets as well as cross-cutting issues (gender, GBV, and management skills). Prior to the distribution of agriculture tools and seeds FAO in close collaboration with local district and sector authorities, FAO will organize sensitization meetings with targeted communities to discuss about project activities and way forward.
